Function Documentation

int FPGA_Close ( void   ) 

Close the FPGA library.

Returns:
Zero if successfully closed FPGA, nonzero otherwise
See also:
fpgalib.h
The function will close the FPGA device file if it was previuosly opened and sets iFPGAStatus to OFF. If the FPGA device is not already opened, the function will return an error code.

Definition at line 97 of file fpgalib.c.

Here is the caller graph for this function:

int FPGA_Open ( void   ) 

Open and initialize the FPGA library.

Returns:
Zero if successfully opened FPGA, nonzero otherwise
See also:
fpgalib.h
The function starts initialization of the FPGA library and should be called at the beginning of any program that wants to access the FPGA design via device files.

Definition at line 61 of file fpgalib.c.

int FPGA_Scramble ( int  operand,
int *  result 
)

Scramble data.

Parameters:
operand An integer value as scrambler input value
result An integer pointer pointing to a variable the scrambler result is to be written to
Returns:
Zero if successfully executed, nonzero otherwise
See also:
fpgalib.h
FPGA_Scramble() is mainly a wrapper function around the corresponding device file write() and read() sequence that has to be called to scramble an operand.

Definition at line 145 of file fpgalib.c.

Here is the call graph for this function:

int FPGA_SetGeneratorPolynom ( int  GP  ) 

Set scrambler generator polynom.

Parameters:
GP An integer value representing the generator polynom
Returns:
Zero if successfully set the generator polynom, nonzero otherwise
See also:
fpgalib.h
The function will set the scrambler's generator polynom for further use with FPGA_Scramble().
